other_tests.findings: A couple subcentimeter hypodensities in the right hepatic lobe likely representing hepatic cyst or biliary hamartomas; abnormal dilatation of the main pancreatic duct measuring up to 5 mm; enlarged appendix measuring up to 2.0 cm with adjacent fat stranding; multiple cortically based hypodense lesions in bilateral kidneys, largest measuring 1.3 cm, likely simple cysts; mild thickening of the cecum and diffusely mildly thick-walled colon, suggesting chronic colitis.
